column5: Hint,  outdoor writer and great guy to hang with. This was my only time and he was a trooper. Found in my files today. used Anise oil on baits  :) Tackle box smelled like a bar. but it worked.
I'm thinking Tiny Bennett from the old Toronto Telegram maybe ?
I think that is Powers. John or Gord, don't recall?

" used Anise oil on baits  " Wow! Some of you guys are real geezers! LOL me too! I don't how much that helped, but it didn't seem to hurt, and it is still available. https://www.lurepartsonline.com/Scented-Worm-Oil
I’m thinking it looks like John Powers too. He used to be outdoors writer for the Toronto Star and I’m pretty sure he used to live in Beaverton.
You are so correct, fished with hima couple of times
Way back when, I cut round roe bag size out of colored sponge , I dipped them in melted wax scented with anise, when I fished the whirlpool.   Worked great.

After I have cooked my maise for carp fishing I always pour half a bottle of anise in it as it is cooling... Don't know the proof but there is nothing like a mad, drunk carp pulling your string...recipe by Photoz  !
Photoz, that's a name I haven't heard in a long time.
He was one of the nicest guys on this board and it's always sad when we lose the good ones too soon.
Long time ago used to fish with him in the Barrie marina, super nice guy and pretty mellow.
I remember going into drug store  for oil of Anise. Long strait hair mid back about 20 not sure why I got strange look from pharmacist .
I had quite a few great conversations with John back in the day but never had the privilege of fishing with him. He was an awesome writer.
